channel.title: Public..Or Not?
channel.description: Well Iv Recently Moved And i got a new modem from At&T and my server won't go public...you only have to port forward if you have a router.. if anyone has suggestions add austin-harmon@hotmail.com..if you help i may give a reward of some kind..

item.title: Public..Or Not?
item.dc:creator: @SkillersDream SkillersDream
item.description:

il post a pic of my no ip client in a sec.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 15, 2008, 09:43:00 am[/size][hr]

Could it be the updating nat/router/proxy??

Read full topic

item.title: Public..Or Not?
item.dc:creator: @IP1 IP
item.description:
@IP1 wrote:

[quote=“verbios, post:13, topic:243859”]Firstly, make sure you did all of the other necessary steps correctly, such as registering a no-ip, enabling your firewall to allow traffic through your port, etc.

Secondly, you can check your default gateway by opening up Command Prompt (run->cmd), and then typing “ipconfig”.

I’m not too familiar with AT&T router, but you can check the port forwarding instructions by going to the PortForwarding.com instructions page.[/quote]

Hehe, pretty much told him exactly what I told him =P.

Read full topic

item.title: Public..Or Not?
item.dc:creator: @verbios verbios
item.description:
@verbios wrote:

Firstly, make sure you did all of the other necessary steps correctly, such as registering a no-ip, enabling your firewall to allow traffic through your port, etc.

Secondly, you can check your default gateway by opening up Command Prompt (run->cmd), and then typing “ipconfig”.

I’m not too familiar with AT&T router, but you can check the port forwarding instructions by going to the PortForwarding.com instructions page.

Read full topic

Hmm, does your router have a number to call or anything? Try looking on google for AT&T Router, and then your router type.

item.title: Public..Or Not?
item.dc:creator: @SkillersDream SkillersDream
item.description:
@SkillersDream wrote:

[quote=“IP, post:6, topic:243859”]Hmm… Have you made sure the router you have isn’t on the list? And is it a router or Modem from AT&T?

Also, log on to your router, usually this and it usually has a Portforwaring/Port Triggering tab.

Press the Portforward and select custom service, and then enter the Description (name), the port (usually 43594 or 5555, whichever port you are running your server on), and finally as the IP address have it 192.168.1.4

And make sure you allow it to access the ports in your Windows Firewall.[/quote]

“192.168.1.4” isn’t my default ip[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 14, 2008, 10:51:09 pm[/size][hr][quote=“IP, post:6, topic:243859”]is it a router or Modem from AT&T?[/quote]

yes it is

Read full topic

item.title: Public..Or Not?
item.dc:creator: @IP1 IP
item.description:
@IP1 wrote:

Hmm… Have you made sure the router you have isn’t on the list? And is it a router or Modem from AT&T?

Also, log on to your router, usually this and it usually has a Portforwaring/Port Triggering tab.

Press the Portforward and select custom service, and then enter the Description (name), the port (usually 43594 or 5555, whichever port you are running your server on), and finally as the IP address have it 192.168.1.4

And make sure you allow it to access the ports in your Windows Firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Public..Or Not?
item.dc:creator: @SkillersDream SkillersDream
item.description:
@SkillersDream wrote:

Thats the problem…i have no idea how to portforward because iv never did it before…iv used the tutorial on “how to make a server” but thats for linkyss, my modem is from At&T

Read full topic

item.title: Public..Or Not?
item.dc:creator: @IP1 IP
item.description:
@IP1 wrote:

Some routers need portforwarding, some do not. Most do, however, like you; my old house did not require Port forwarding.

Make sure to do the following:

~ Register a Domain
~ Check the Domain in No-Ip DUC Client
~ Allow firewalls to access that port
~ Portforward the port via router (Click here for help)
~ Make sure the client has the correct IP address/Port
~ Make sure the server is running on the correct Port you put in client/portforwarded to on router.

Read full topic
